thread.title: Telluride says more flights available this ski season
thread.title_full: Telluride says more flights available this ski season

author: Ben Miller
title: Telluride says more flights available this ski season
text:
Telluride says more flights available this ski season Aug 31, 2015, 7:58am MDT Industries & Tags Thinkstock Telluride said more airlines are adding flights for the 2015-2016 ski season. The Telluride ski area said that there will be more flights flying into the Montrose airport this coming ski season. Telluride said that United Airlines , American Airlines and Allegiant are boosting seasonal flights to Montrose/Telluride Airport, which is the nearest airport with commercial service, located 66 miles away from the ski area. (Rich people can fly their private jets into Telluride Regional Airport, which is six miles away from the ski area.) Telluride said new flights for the upcoming ski season include flights to and from New York's LaGuardia Airport on United; Chicago's O'Hare Airport on American; Los Angeles International Airport on American; and Las Vegas International Airport on Allegiant. "We're absolutely thrilled with the significant additions to our air service, giving Telluride / Montrose some of the best access in ski country," said Matt Skinner , chief operating officer of Colorado Flights, which used to be known as the Telluride Montrose Regional Air Organization, in a statement . Telluride is the state's eighth-largest ski area, ranked by skiable acres with 2,000 skiable acres, according to Denver Business Journal research . Ben Miller contributes to the Denver Business Journal and compiles the Morning Edition email newsletter.
